channel.title: C# on .Net Programmer Incubator
channel.description: Recent content in C# on .Net Programmer Incubator

item.title: ASP.NET MVC?
item.description: ASP.NET Core is a web framework that can be used to build web applications and services. It provides a lot of features such as cross-platform support, high-performance, middleware, dependency injection, configuration, routing, and logging. On the other hand, ASP.NET Core MVC is an extension of ASP.NET Core that specifically focuses on building web applications using the Model-View-Controller (MVC) pattern. The MVC pattern is a design pattern that separates the application logic into three interconnected components: the Model (data layer), View (user interface), and Controller (application logic).

item.title: Getting Started
item.description: Visual Studio is an intuitive and feature-rich Integrated Development Environment (IDE) that supports ASP.NET Core development on multiple platforms. It offers powerful debugging tools, advanced code completion, and navigation features, and seamless integration with Microsoft’s cloud platform, Azure. As a result, it greatly simplifies the development of ASP.NET Core applications, making it a popular choice among developers. Install Visual Studio: Go to the Visual Studio download page on the Microsoft website.

item.title: Hello World!
item.description: In this article, we will create our first application in Asp.Net Core MVC. Let’s Create our first project in Asp.Net Core MVC: Open Visual Studio and click on “Create a new project” from the start menu. Select the ASP.NET Core Web App (Model-View-Controller) template and click “Next”. Enter a name for your project and click “Next”. Select the “.NET 7.0(Standard Term Support)” or latest version framework and clic “Create”. The project is created and the “Solution Explorer” window is displayed.
